casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
David Matthew LOWE. No. 278PA15. Supreme Court of North Carolina. Jan. 28, 2016. M. Gordon Widenhouse, Jr., Chapel Hill, Attorney at Law, for Lowe, David Matthew. Derrick Mertz, Special Deputy Attorney General, for State of North Carolina. N. Lorrin Freeman, District, for State of North Carolina.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendant on the 7th of August 2015 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 28th of January 2016."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 25th of August 2015 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 28th of January 2016."

Therefore the case is docketed as of the date of this order's certification. Briefs of the respective parties shall be submitted to this Court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 15(g)(2).
